18#include "ODUPCEANCommon.h"
19
20namespace ZXing {
21namespace OneD {
22
23const std::array<int, 3> UPCEANCommon::START_END_PATTERN = { 1, 1, 1 };
24const std::array<int, 5> UPCEANCommon::MIDDLE_PATTERN = { 1, 1, 1, 1, 1 };
25const std::array<int, 6> UPCEANCommon::UPCE_END_PATTERN = { 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1 };
26
27const std::array<std::array<int, 4>, 10> UPCEANCommon::L_PATTERNS = {
28 3, 2, 1, 1, // 0
29 2, 2, 2, 1, // 1
30 2, 1, 2, 2, // 2
31 1, 4, 1, 1, // 3
32 1, 1, 3, 2, // 4
33 1, 2, 3, 1, // 5
34 1, 1, 1, 4, // 6
35 1, 3, 1, 2, // 7
36 1, 2, 1, 3, // 8
37 3, 1, 1, 2, // 9
38};
39
40const std::array<std::array<int, 4>, 20> UPCEANCommon::L_AND_G_PATTERNS = {
41 3, 2, 1, 1, // 0
42 2, 2, 2, 1, // 1
43 2, 1, 2, 2, // 2
44 1, 4, 1, 1, // 3
45 1, 1, 3, 2, // 4
46 1, 2, 3, 1, // 5
47 1, 1, 1, 4, // 6
48 1, 3, 1, 2, // 7
49 1, 2, 1, 3, // 8
50 3, 1, 1, 2, // 9
51 // reversed
52 1, 1, 2, 3, // 10
53 1, 2, 2, 2, // 11
54 2, 2, 1, 2, // 12
55 1, 1, 4, 1, // 13
56 2, 3, 1, 1, // 14
57 1, 3, 2, 1, // 15
58 4, 1, 1, 1, // 16
59 2, 1, 3, 1, // 17
60 3, 1, 2, 1, // 18
61 2, 1, 1, 3, // 19
62};
63
64// For an UPC-E barcode, the final digit is represented by the parities used
65// to encode the middle six digits, according to the table below.
66//
67// Parity of next 6 digits
68// Digit 0 1 2 3 4 5
69// 0 Even Even Even Odd Odd Odd
70// 1 Even Even Odd Even Odd Odd
71// 2 Even Even Odd Odd Even Odd
72// 3 Even Even Odd Odd Odd Even
73// 4 Even Odd Even Even Odd Odd
74// 5 Even Odd Odd Even Even Odd
75// 6 Even Odd Odd Odd Even Even
76// 7 Even Odd Even Odd Even Odd
77// 8 Even Odd Even Odd Odd Even
78// 9 Even Odd Odd Even Odd Even
79//
80// The encoding is represented by the following array, which is a bit pattern
81// using Odd = 0 and Even = 1. For example, 5 is represented by:
82//
83// Odd Even Even Odd Odd Even
84// in binary:
85// 0 1 1 0 0 1 == 0x19
86//
87const std::array<int, 20> UPCEANCommon::NUMSYS_AND_CHECK_DIGIT_PATTERNS = {
88 0x38, 0x34, 0x32, 0x31, 0x2C, 0x26, 0x23, 0x2A, 0x29, 0x25,
89 0x07, 0x0B, 0x0D, 0x0E, 0x13, 0x19, 0x1C, 0x15, 0x16, 0x1A,
90};
91
92
93} // OneD
94} // ZXing
